title: Broomfield Park
text:
Broomfield Park was a <a href="association%20football">football</a> stadium in <a href="Airdrie%2C%20North%20Lanarkshire">Airdrie, North Lanarkshire</a>, home of <a href="Airdrieonians%20F.C.%20%281878%29">Airdrieonians</a> from 1892 until it was closed after the <a href="1993%E2%80%9394%20in%20Scottish%20football">1993–94 football season</a>.
Airdrieonians F.C. was formed in 1878 and the club opened Broomfield in 1892. The Broomfield corner pavilion was built in 1907. After winning the <a href="1923%E2%80%9324%20Scottish%20Cup">1923–24 Scottish Cup</a>, the club built a main stand, adjacent to the pavilion. The <a href="Scottish%20football%20attendance%20records">record attendance</a> at Broomfield Park was 24,000, in a <a href="Scottish%20Cup">Scottish Cup</a> quarter-final match against <a href="Heart%20of%20Midlothian%20F.C.">Hearts</a> on 8 March 1952. Floodlights were installed in 1956, and a roof was built over the Enclosure (opposite the main stand) in 1959. The ground was unusually narrow, at just 67 yards wide, and was built in a natural hollow. These physical features, and the proximity of the stands to the pitch, meant that Broomfield had a particularly raucous and oppressive atmosphere when crowded, which visiting clubs disliked but was advantageous to the home side.
Airdrieonians first explored the options for moving from Broomfield in 1989. A planning application was rejected by a public inquiry in 1993, but that same hearing allowed Broomfield to be redeveloped as a <a href="supermarket">supermarket</a>. Airdrieonians chose to sell Broomfield to supermarket chain <a href="Safeway%20%28UK%29">Safeway</a> (now a Morrison's supermarket after the latter taking over the former's UK stores) despite not having an alternative ground ready to move into. The last game at Broomfield was played on 7 May 1994 and the club then shared <a href="Broadwood%20Stadium">Broadwood Stadium</a>, in <a href="Cumbernauld">Cumbernauld</a>, with <a href="Clyde%20F.C.">Clyde</a>. Monklands District backed a plan for a 10,000-seat stadium at Raebog, but the proposal was rejected by <a href="Strathclyde%20Region">Strathclyde Region</a> in October 1995. A proposal for a site at Craigneuk was rejected by Monklands District in April 1996. After four years at Broadwood, Airdrieonians moved into the <a href="Excelsior%20Stadium">Shyberry Excelsior Stadium</a> in 1998. Airdrieonians was liquidated in 2002 and replaced by <a href="Airdrie%20United%20F.C.">Airdrie United</a>. In June 2013, the Scottish Football Association permitted Airdrie United to formally change their name back to Airdrieonians.
